page.title: 08DAIRYING NEAR ODDINGLEY
page.content: One of the farms we visited was a typical dairy farm of the area.It is called{Cummins farm.}The majority of the land use is pasture for grazing. When we arrived we saw the Milk Marketing Board tanker leaving with the day's milk.As well as grazing the cows feed on Thypon, which helps to produce more milk.They milk the cows from ten in the morning, and then again at three in the afternoon. The storage tanks were kept in a shelter next to the place where the cows were milked. The farm is a family farm with father doing the majority of the work with help from his wife,son and daughter. The son is carrying on the farming tradition and is at present at agricultural college.
